results.title: Persevere
results.creator_credit: John Vincent, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Soon after landing in South Vietnam, John Vincent was sent to Pleiku to serve as a Platoon Commander. In telling of his time in Pleiku, John considers the cultural assumptions he made and the importance of his training in military action.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Vincent, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: For all who served
results.creator_credit: Jack Holdsworth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jack Holdsworth is one of the few remaining ‘Rats of Tobruk’. Here he reflects fondly on his time during the war and how the extreme circumstances created a strong bond between soldiers and their commanding officers. This bond, as Jack puts it, is a ‘hard habit to break’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Holdsworth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Jack Holdsworth is one of the few remaining ‘Rats of Tobruk’. Here he reflects fondly on his time during the war and how the extreme circumstances created a strong bond between soldiers and their commanding officers. This bond, as Jack puts it, is a ‘hard habit to break’.

results.title: Inspired by veterans
results.creator_credit: Hugh Melville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: So keen was Hugh Melville to join his older brother in the second world war, that he deliberately failed first year Medicine to achieve his goal. While Hugh travelled extensively and fought in different countries, it was the men he fought with that were an inspiration to him, back then and for the rest of his life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh Melville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Homecoming
results.creator_credit: Grant Coultman-Smith, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite the horrors of fighting in the Vietnam War, Grant Coultman-Smith and his fellow soldiers were unprepared for the reception when they returned to Australia. Rejected by the people, the Returned Services League and even the Government, Grant and his colleagues found comfort and support in each other as they fought the psychological effects of war and achieving greater recognition for their service in the community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grant Coultman-Smith, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Despite the horrors of fighting in the Vietnam War, Grant Coultman-Smith and his fellow soldiers were unprepared for the reception when they returned to Australia. Rejected by the people, the Returned Services League and even the Government, Grant and his colleagues found comfort and support in each other as they fought the psychological effects of war and achieving greater recognition for their service in the community.

results.title: The Correspondence
results.creator_credit: Gordon White, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gordon White, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.

With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.

results.title: Traditions
results.creator_credit: Con Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Conscription brought Con Bell into World War II. Regardless of how he entered the war, Con is proud of the part he played in the development of a new army tradition. A member of the first permanent commando squadrons, he reflects on how this experience has shaped the man he is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Con Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Freedom
results.creator_credit: Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: During his trip back to Normandy on the 65th anniversary of D-day, Bob Gatherum reflects on the lasting legacy of war. Travelling through Normandy, he was surprised and amazed at the appreciation shown by the local people whose freedom he and his fellow soldiers had helped protect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Raj Roy interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

video_links.name: Raj Roy interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

results.brief_description: As Head of Film at MoMA (The Museum of Modern Art), New York, Raj Roy discusses the role of the film department including acquisitions, exhibitions, research, and preservation. Roy then speaks of his broad involvement in ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’, including the challenge of selecting the chosen artworks from tens of thousands of archived pieces. His main hope for the exhibition is that it will spark the creativity of budding artists and create the next Tim Burton.
results.description: As Head of Film at MoMA (The Museum of Modern Art), New York, Raj Roy discusses the role of the film department including acquisitions, exhibitions, research, and preservation. Roy then speaks of his broad involvement in ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’, including the challenge of selecting the chosen artworks from tens of thousands of archived pieces. His main hope for the exhibition is that it will spark the creativity of budding artists and create the next Tim Burton.

Roy then speaks of his broad involvement in ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’, including the challenge of selecting the chosen artworks from tens of thousands of archived pieces. His main hope for the exhibition is that it will spark the creativity of budding artists and create the next Tim Burton.

results.title: One past eight futures "The making of"
results.brief_description: This mini-documentary takes us behind the scenes of the ‘One past eight futures’ Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI. The participants of this particular workshop are eight young indigenous people who are part of the Indigenous Youth Leadership program. They discuss their stories, their participation in the workshop and what they have gained from the experience. The results are a social and cultural snapshot of Australia’s Indigenous youth, through their stories, their ties to the past and, mostly, their hopes for the future.

results.title: Change!
results.creator_credit: Tori Towney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Tori Towney came from an encouraging and supportive family. Growing up, she resisted the urge to join her friends drinking and instead listened to the stories of her father, of his harsh and poor upbringing. When her mum encouraged her to move to Sydney and take up a scholarship at St Catherine’s, she grabbed this opportunity with both hands. Tori candidly shares what it was like to be away from home with no support network and how she overcame that and adapted to her new and exciting environment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tori Towney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Tori Towney came from an encouraging and supportive family. Growing up, she resisted the urge to join her friends drinking and instead listened to the stories of her father, of his harsh and poor upbringing. When her mum encouraged her to move to Sydney and take up a scholarship at St Catherine’s, she grabbed this opportunity with both hands. Tori candidly shares what it was like to be away from home with no support network and how she overcame that and adapted to her new and exciting environment.
description_for_label: Tori Towney came from an encouraging and supportive family. Growing up, she resisted the urge to join her friends drinking and instead listened to the stories of her father, of his harsh and poor upbringing. When her mum encouraged her to move to Sydney and take up a scholarship at St Catherine’s, she grabbed this opportunity with both hands. Tori candidly shares what it was like to be away from home with no support network and how she overcame that and adapted to her new and exciting environment.
